subject: Re: [junit] Suite setup not always run from Eclipse
msgSnippet: Currently, I don t think there s a default way to do this.  There s probably two steps to get there: 1) Create a feature enhancement request for JUnit to allow
messageBody:
Currently, I don't think there's a default way to do this. There's
probably two steps to get there:

1) Create a feature enhancement request for JUnit to allow a test
class to link back to the suite in whose context it must run.

2) Create a feature enhancement request for Eclipse to honor such a link.

In the meantime, I fear you're stuck with some sort of lazily set-up
solution, with a @BeforeClass on the individual test class that runs
the suite's BeforeClass code if it hasn't already been run.

Or, a custom Runner that does the same...

David Saff

On 3/9/07, frbaxter1 <frank@...> wrote:
> I have a set of tests that must always be configured before they can
> be executed. I did this using a Suite like this:
>
> @RunWith(DynamicTestSuite.class)
> public class AllTests
> {
> @BeforeClass
> public static void beforeEverything()
> {
> ...
> }
>
> @AfterClass
> public static void afterEverything()
> {
> ...
> }
> }
>
> This works great whenever I run my tests using this class. However,
> when one of my tests fails, I go right click on it and run it
> individually. Once I do that, the Eclipse plugin just runs that
> class, it completely ignores the fact that it came from a suite. My
> individual test has no knowledge of the test setup, so the test fails
> because the setup was not done properly.
>
> Is there a way to get the Eclipse plugin to always run the suite
> @BeforeClass method, even if it's running a single test?
>
> I'm using Eclipse 3.2, with JUnit 4 installed.
